question: What is the most specific marker for myocardial infarction?
A continuous, "machine-like" murmur is associated with what congenital pathology?
Which cardiac dysfunction is seen in restrictive cardiomyopathy?

answers.option: It has no effect on systolic or diastolic function of heart
Systolic dysfunction that converts to diastolic with increasing severity

question: A 2-year-old baby had congenital heart disease. Which syndrome is most commonly associated with congenital heart disease?

A 30-year-old patient is identified with hypertension in his upper extremities and hypotension in his lower extremities. His X-ray shows notches on his ribs. What is the most likely condition ssociated with his presentations?
'Sign of 3' is a feature of which congenital disease of the heart?
What is the name of the point which adjoins the QRS complex and the ST segment?
Which of the following findings would indicate a high-risk factor prediction while performing the exercise tolerance test (ETT)?

answers.option: 3 mm Hg drop in diastolic blood pressure
Upsloping ST depression of 3 mm in V2-V6
2 mm ST depression in inferior leads
5 mm Hg drop in systolic blood pressure

question: A patient taking a class of antihypertensives complains about side effects of severe dry cough. Which of the following drugs is causing the dry cough?
Which of the following correctly defines idiosyncrasy?

answers.option: Adverse effects that are infrequent and sporadically seen among the population even with low dosages
Adverse effects that generally occur in the majority of population

question: Which of the following is a side effect of angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors?
Which vasculitis involves the aorta?
In which of the following is the sinoatrial node present?
Which of the following leads to constrictive cardiomyopathy in transfusion dependent thalassemia?
Peripheral cyanosis occurs in which of the following pathologies?

answers.option: Congenital heart diseases (right to left shunt)

question: A 46-year-old woman suffering from obesity is traveling from Pakistan to USA. She starts experiencing shortness of breath. Which of the following could be a likely reason?
On autopsy, internal aspects of the stomach show brown folds and hardened esophagus. The acid involved will be:
Oligemic lung fields on X-ray chest are seen in which of the following conditions?
Anticoagulants are given after which of the following mitral valve surgeries?
What amount of charcoal is required as an antidote?
Which of the following is the gold standard test for diagnosing coronary artery disease?
A term infant is born with a large ventricular septal defect (VSD). Which congenital heart disease is most commonly associated with VSD?

A 45-year-old man presents to the clinic because of tingling or numbness in the hands along with pain in his extremities. He has a 20-pack year history of smoking and is finally diagnosed with vasculitis involving medium and small arteries with veins. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following is true about diastolic heart sounds?

answers.option: Tricuspid regurgitation produce holodiastolic murmur at 4th intercostal space
A long or holodiastolic rumbling is indicative of severe mitral stenosis
Acute severe AR produce late diastolic murmur at apex
MVP usually produces early diastolic murmur
Tricuspid stenosis does not produce any diastolic sounds

question: A 42-year-old man comes to the emergency department with a history of taking liquids for suicide purpose. His pulse rate is 92/min and blood pressure is 120 /70 mmhg. He also has ulceration around the mouth and tongue. His chest is full of crepts and has severely labored breathing. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial step in management?
Which type of atrial septal defect (ASD) is commonly associated with atrioventricular (AV) canal defect?
A 25-year-old man complains of sharp pain which increases on lying down and is relieved with sitting. What is the diagnosis?
Acid neutralization within the stomach, in case of sulphuric acid ingestion, is contraindicated by which of the following?
Which of the following conditions is characterized by normal plasma B type natriuretic peptide (BNP) levels?
Which one of the following tests (non-invasive) has the highest sensitivity in detecting coronary artery disease?
Which one of the following is correct regarding mitral stenosis (MS)?

answers.option: The patient remains asymptomatic until the valve area is less than 1 cm^2
Turbulent flow produces the characteristic low pitched mid diastolic murmur
Mitral balloon valvotomy can be safely done in patients with heavily calcified mitral valve
It is mostly congenital in origin
Antibiotic prophylaxis against infective endocarditis is given to all patients

question: Which of the following factors has an association with congenital heart disease?

A 25-year-old patient with difficulty in breathing is diagnosed to have congestive heart failure. He is found to have differences in right and left arm pulses, diminished femoral pulses and notching of ribs on X-ray. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following examination findings would most likely be seen in a patient with aortic stenosis?

answers.option: Murmur loudest along left sternal border
Intensity of murmur directly related to the severity of the lesion

question: Which of the following conditions is characterized by a sustained apex impulse?
A researcher wants to establish the prevalence of tuberculosis in Karachi. Which study design is most suitable for this?
What is the most common type of cardiomyopathy?

A 40-year-old male presents with complaints of increasing breathlessness, fatigue, and weakness for the last 2 months. He has a history of mediastinal Hodgkin lymphoma treated with radiation therapy 5 years ago. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of these is a modifiable risk factor for the prevention of cardiovascular diseases?
Which of the following is not a characteristic of an ideal homicidal poison?
How many seconds does a normal PR interval last?
What is the most common poison used to commit suicide in Pakistan?
Which of the following works by blocking VLDL synthesis?
What is the mechanism of action of nitrates?
A marble factory worker complains of cough and shortness of breath. He may have which of the following diseases?
An ethical review committee permission is necessary for most research studies. Which of the following research studies does not require permission?

A 55-year-old male presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with abdominal discomfort and swelling of his legs for the past two years. On physical examination, jugular venous pressure is raised even when sitting up. The liver is enlarged and tender. Which of the following is most likely to cause these?
What is the recommended amount of exercise to prevent cardiovascular disease?
Which of the following has a decreased risk of cardiovascular disease?

An industrialist asks a public health specialist about the measures he can take to control and prevent heart disease among employees. The public health specialist advises on the modifiable risk factors that can be addressed to lower the risk of cardiovascular diseases. Which one of the following options illustrates the modifiable risk factor that the industrialist can focus on?

A 45-year-old man visits a doctor for his concern regarding his risk of heart disease. He explains that his father died of a heart attack at the age of 52 years. He seeks advice on diet. The doctor advises cutting down on the use of certain fats. Which of the following options illustrates the most important food group to be avoided by the person?

A public health specialist is contacted by the district health authorities for advice on primary preventive strategies for reducing the long-term risk of cardiovascular diseases in the population. Which one of the following options illustrates the most feasible solution for overall risk reduction in the population?

answers.option: Building walking and cycling parks/ tracks
Screening for diabetes and heart disease

question: A 45-year-old woman on antiarrhythmic therapy comes with signs and symptoms of hypothyroidism (such as weight gain, constipation, cold intolerance, and menstrual irregularities). Hypothyroidism is a possible consequence of prolonged therapy with which of the following drugs?

A patient receiving a class I antiarrhythmic agent on a long-term basis complains of fatigue, low-grade fever, and joint pain suggestive of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). The patient is most likely using which of the following antiarrhythmic drugs?

A 36-year-old male smoker, a known case of heart failure, presents to the emergency with severe lower limb edema with difficulty breathing. Which of the following is the drug of choice in this case (that can improve breathing capacity by resolving edema)?

A 45-year-old patient presents to the emergency in an unconscious state. Blood analysis is done and the result shows that the patient has hypokalemia and hypomagnesemia, while the electrocardiogram suggests heart failure. Which of the following drugs is contraindicated in this case?

A 65-year-old woman with a medical history of type II diabetes, obesity, and hypertension visits the outpatient department. She had been told her cholesterol was elevated in the past and states that she has been following a "low cholesterol diet" for the past 6 months after seeing a dietician. A fasting lipid profile is performed and revealed an LDL (low-density lipoprotein) of 160 mg/dl (normal value should be less than 100 mg/dl), HDL (high-density lipoprotein) of 45 mg/dl (should be 250 mg/dl), and total cholesterol of 250mg/dl (normal range between 125-200mg/dl). Which of the following drugs should be preferred for the patient?

A 55-year-old Caucasian man presents with polyuria, and polydipsia for the past 2 months. He has a 3-year history of poorly controlled hypertriglyceridemia. His initial fasting serum cholesterol is 250 mg/dl, triglycerides are 928 mg/dl (normal value 200 mg/dl), and high-density lipoprotein (HDL) is 30 mg/dl (should be 250 mg/dl). Which of the following is the best treatment option for this patient?

A 55-year-old female patient is admitted to the hospital with a progressive increase in breathlessness, orthopnea, and ankle edema over the previous 3 weeks. She is apyrexial yet tachypnoeic (25/min) with a low-volume pulse. Echocardiography shows a dilated heart (left ventricular end-diastolic distension (LVEDD) 650 mm) with anterior and septal hypokinesis. She is diagnosed with a case of progressive systolic heart failure and the physician decides to start digitalis on this patient. What is the mechanism of action of digitalis by which it can increase the contractility of cardiac muscle?

answers.option: By inhibiting the Na+/K+ ATPase, increasing the intracellular Cl- ion concentration
By inhibiting the Na+/K+ ATPase, decreasing the intracellular Ca+ ion concentration
By inhibiting the Na+/K+ ATPase, increasing the intracellular K+ ion concentration
By inhibiting the Na+/K+ ATPase, increasing the intracellular Na+ ion concentration
By inhibiting the Na+/K+ ATPase, decreasing the intracellular Na+ ion concentration

question: A 45-year-old male complains of constipation. He is recently started on two antihypertensives due to elevated systolic blood pressure (greater than 20 mmHg above goal). His current medications include lisinopril, chlorthalidone, verapamil, rosuvastatin, and aspirin. Which is most likely contributing to his constipation?

A 52-year-old female has uncontrolled hypertension (blood pressure 154/82 mm Hg) and is on treatment with lisinopril. She recently had a myocardial infarction and her past medical history includes diabetes and hyperlipidemia. Considering her indications, which agent may be appropriate to add to her antihypertensive therapy?

A 55-year-old man experiences crushing substernal chest pain after arriving at work one morning. Over the next 5 hours, the pain persists and begins to radiate to his left arm. He becomes diaphoretic and short of breath but waits until the end of his 8-hour shift to go to the hospital. Which of the following laboratory tests has elevated value and would be most useful for the diagnosis of this patient on admission to the hospital?

A 52-year-old man has a sudden onset of severe substernal chest pain that radiates to the neck. On physical examination, he is afebrile but has tachycardia, hyperventilation, and hypotension. No cardiac murmurs are heard on auscultation. Emergent coronary angiography shows a thrombotic occlusion of the left circumflex artery and areas of 50% to 70% narrowing in the proximal circumflex and anterior descending arteries. Which of the following complications of this disease is most likely to occur within 1 hour of these events?

A 2-year-old child is brought to the physician for a routine examination. Physical examination shows a low-pitched cardiac murmur. An echocardiogram shows the presence of ostium secundum, with a 1-cm defect. Which of the following abnormalities is most likely to be found in this child?

A 58-year-old man has had progressive dyspnea for 1 year. On physical examination, extensive rales are heard on chest auscultation. An echocardiogram shows that the left ventricular wall is markedly hypertrophied. A chest radiograph shows pulmonary edema and a prominent left-sided heart shadow. Which of the following conditions has most likely produced these findings?

An elderly patient with a history of heart disease is brought to the emergency room with difficulty breathing. Examination reveals that she has pulmonary edema. Which treatment is indicated using the most potent diuretic?

An infant born at term is noted to have cyanosis during the first week of life. On examination, a heart murmur is auscultated. Investigations show an overriding aorta, ventricular septal defect, right ventricular thickening, and pulmonic stenosis. This infant is most likely to have an inherited mutation involving which of the following genes?

A 12-year-old boy is admitted to the hospital with jerking movements of limbs and shortness of breath. He has complaints of painful joints. Examination shows an erythematous rash on the skin. To make a diagnosis of rheumatic fever, you need to utilize Jones criteria. Minor Jones criteria include which of the following?

A 5-year-old child presents with shortness of breath and chest pain. He complains of coughing during the night. On auscultation, the physician detects a soft, high-pitched, early diastolic murmur. An echocardiogram shows aortic regurgitation. What is the most common predisposing condition?
Embryologically, where do the left pulmonary artery and the ductus arteriosus arise from?

answers.option: Left fourth and sixth aortic arches, respectively
Left sixth and fourth aortic arches, respectively

question: A 55-years-male patient comes to the emergency room with severe chest pain. His electrocardiogram shows inferior wall ST-elevation myocardial infarction. While the doctor is managing the patient, he develops bradycardia and syncopal attacks. The cardiac monitor shows complete atrioventricular dissociation. What is the next best step of the treatment?

A 15-year-old boy is admitted to the hospital with shortness of breath and chest pain. He has painful knees and elbows. Examination shows a few nodules below the skin. He has a history of a sore throat from a few weeks back. Which of the following could be the bacteria responsible for his sore throat?

The biopsy of the heart of a 35-year-old patient, who died because of a sudden cardiac event, shows fibrosis with thickened and retracted mitral valve cusps. Which of the following would she have been suffering from?

A patient is admitted to the cardiology ward with complaints of shortness of breath upon exertion, cough during the night, fatigue, and swelling of legs and feet. A systolic murmur is audible. He is diagnosed with mitral insufficiency. What is the most likely cause of mitral valve prolapse?

A 66-year-old patient develops chest pain with a rapid heartbeat. He is also feeling shortness of breath and is slightly dizzy. He is diagnosed with aortic stenosis. What is the most common cause of aortic stenosis?
After 6 hours of delivery, a baby crashes in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU). What infusion will you start to save the life of the baby?
In a 20-year-old patient, during the cardiovascular examination, you hear a pansystolic murmur of grade 4/6 Intensity at the left sternal border. What is your most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old man presents for a medical checkup before job recruitment. On examination, a wide fixed splitting of the second heart sound and a systolic flow murmur is found over the pulmonary area. The patient denies any symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 17-day-old infant is brought to the pediatrician's clinic for poor feeding. She is born to a first-time mother without any complications. Cardiac examination reveals a grade 3/6 continuous machine-like murmur over the left infraclavicular area with a widened pulse pressure. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 67-year-old man presents to the emergency department with typical chest pain. Medical history includes diabetes and hypertension. His troponin levels are raised. Coronary angiography demonstrates diffuse three-vessel coronary artery disease and he has a poor left ventricular function with low ejection fraction. Which of the following is not the risk factor for the development of ischemic heart disease?

A 55-year-old male patient with diabetes with a family history of ischemic heart disease comes to the outpatient department with his echocardiography report showing a low ejection fraction. The doctor advises him to get his angiography done, which reveals diffuse three-vessel disease. What is the treatment of choice for diffuse three-vessel coronary artery disease along with low ejection fraction?

answers.option: Herbal treatment along with honey and apple juice

question: A 58-year-old male patient comes to the clinic with chest pain and profuse sweating for the last hour. He has a 20-pack year history of smoking. Medical history includes type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. His blood pressure is 150/90 mmHg and his pulse is 100/min. His electrocardiogram shows extensive anterior wall myocardial Infarction. He is given aspirin 300 mg and clopidogrel 300 mg along with sublingual nitrate. As soon as he swallows the tablets, he develops fits-like activity and his blood pressure rapidly drops. The cardiac monitor shows bizarre and chaotic electrical activity. Which one is the next best step of treatment?

A 75-year-old lady comes with a complaint of missed beats. She has history of stable angina for the last 10 years. She is taking atenolol 100 mg once a day and ivabradine 5 mg twice a day along with nitrates. Her blood pressure is 110/50 mmHg and her pulse is 66/minute but regularly irregular. On further inquiry, she admits that she sometimes feels dizzy. Your senior colleague informs you that she is having a Wenkebach phenomenon. Which one will be the best management step?

answers.option: Readjust the medical treatment and observe the cardiac rhythm

question: A 25-year-old male patient comes to the clinic with chest pain and a dizzy feeling. On examination, he has an ejection systolic murmur over the base of the heart. His echocardiography report shows severe aortic stenosis. What is the most common cause of aortic stenosis worldwide?
What is the main difference between cyanide and hydrocyanic acid?

A 12-year-old girl has been found to have mitral valve regurgitation on an echocardiogram. She is suspected to have rheumatic heart disease. To confirm the diagnosis clinically, Jones criteria is used. Which of the following is not true for the modified Jones criteria?

answers.option: Erythema marginatum is a major criterion
Prolong PR interval is a minor criterion

question: What is the standard test for aortic stenosis?
Which of the following is an indication for secondary prophylaxis in patients with rheumatic heart disease if the patient is allergic to penicillin?

A 28-year-old male smoker is feeling atypical chest pain for two weeks. He is anxious as his cousin died at the age of 40 and he was also a smoker. Which one is the best test for screening for ischemic heart disease?

A 32-year-old male comes to you with his lipid profile report that is showing dyslipidemia. He is a pilot by profession and is anxious about his job and fitness. He tells that he has a family history of dyslipidemia and one of his uncles died of a heart attack at the age of 40. He is otherwise healthy and denies any symptoms of angina. Considering his high-risk profession, which one is the best test to screen him for ischemic heart disease?
What is the mechanism of action for cyanide poisoning?
A person ingested bleach containing oxalic acid. What is the immediate at-home antidote that can be administered?
Which of the following corrosive causes hypocalcemia?
What is the main antidote for cyanide poisoning?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department with a complaint of fever for the past 10 days. The fever is high grade. He also has complaints of pain in his right shoulder and right knee pain. For the past 2 days, he is complaining of a respiratory tract infection from 3 weeks back. What is the most likely diagnosis?
You are evaluating a patient with rheumatic fever. He had carditis at diagnosis but no residual valvular disease at discharge. How long will you advise for secondary prophylaxis?

answers.option: 10 years or till 40 years of age whichever is longer
2 years or till 21 years of age whichever is longer
10 years or till 21 years of age whichever is longer
5 years or till 21 years of age whichever is longer

question: A 10-year-old boy has a history of fever, joint swelling, rash, and new-onset murmur. His anti-streptolysin O titer (ASOT) is raised along with raised ESR. Which of the following is likely to be present in his recent medical history?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of typical chest pain radiating to her left arm associated with vomiting for the past three hours. She has a habit of smoking. Her vitals show a blood pressure of 130/70 mmHg and a regular pulse of 130 beats per minute. The systemic examination is remarkable. Her electrocardiogram(ECG) showed an ST-segment elevation in inferior ECG leads. What would be the most appropriate test for this patient?
Which of the following is incorrect for an incised wound?

answers.option: The maximum measurement of an incised wound is its length
It is always caused by a sharp weapon

question: Which of the following drugs is given sublingually to relieve the pain of angina pectoris?
Which drug will be given for acute treatment of angina?
Which antihypertensive is used topically to treat alopecia areata?
Which antihypertensive can cause rebound hypertension on sudden discontinuation?
Which coagulation factor falls most rapidly after starting warfarin?
Which of the following is the most common indication for coronary artery bypass graft (CABG)?

answers.option: 20% or greater stenosis of right coronary artery (RCA)
50% or less than 50% stenosis of left coronary artery (LCA)

question: A child has been cyanotic since birth. He has pulmonary edema and shortness of breath but no signs of congestive cardiac failure are found. Which of the following associated abnormalities would he have?
Aspirin causes increased bleeding time by which of the following mechanisms?

answers.option: Inhibits thromboxane A2 synthesis in platelets
Inhibits prostacyclin release from endothelial cells

question: Which of the following is an adverse side effect of fibrinolytic therapy?

A child presents to the clinic with a complaint of repeated infections and pneumonia since birth. On examination, a systolic murmur is heard at the left 4th intercostal space, and biventricular hypertrophy is found on imaging. What is the likely diagnosis?
Gastric lavage is absolutely contraindicated in which of the following situations?

answers.option: When patient comes with volatile poisoning
When patient comes with strychnine poisoning
When patient comes with sulphuric acid poisoning
When patient comes after four to six hours of poisoning
When patient has poisoning with carbolic acid

question: An infant born at term is noted to have cyanosis during the first week of life. On examination, a heart murmur is auscultated. Investigations show an overriding aorta, ventricular septal defect, right ventricular thickening, and pulmonic stenosis. This infant is most likely to have which congenital anomaly?

A 54-year-old female presents to the emergency with shortness of breath for 4 months and is unable to perform her daily activities. She has a history of hyperlipidemia, diabetes, and three-vessel coronary artery disease for about 4 years. On examination, bilateral crepitations/crackles are present in the lungs. What is the diagnosis of her condition?

A 60-year-old patient presents to the clinic with crushing chest pain radiating to the left arm. He is given sublingual nitroglycerin but it does not improve his condition. If the pain lasts for >20 minutes it is more likely to be which of the following conditions?
A patient presents to the clinic with chest pain and is diagnosed with angina pectoris. Which of the following cells sustain the initial injury due to angina pectoris resulting from arterial disease?

A 28-year-old male, with a known case of hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy, presents in the cardiac emergency room with a complaint of recurrent syncope. His elder brother died at the age of 30 years. Which of the following is the definite treatment that can prevent sudden cardiac death in this patient?
High-dose long-term use of hydralazine causes which of the following effects?
A researcher is conducting a study in which he will be following COVID-19 patients (both men and women) to find the long term complications of coronavirus. What type of study is this?
What is the process by which one activates and sustains thoughts, behavior, and emotions, in order to reach his goal?
Which factor influences self-regulation?
What is the purpose of screening questions in a research questionnaire?
What brings bias to the research questionnaire?
A professor asks his students to code all the data that is being collected. What is its significance?
What are the right ventricular changes seen in acute cor pulmonale?
Which of the following is a branch of the left coronary artery that runs in the interventricular septum?

A 53-year-old obese male comes to the clinic with complaints of recurrent chest pain. He has experienced similar chest pains for the past few years. He also experiences cramps while walking. His blood glucose level is 170 mg/dl and his cholesterol level is 358 mg/dl. His ECG and cardiac markers are normal. What is the underlying pathology of this condition?
A child is found to have a defect at the limbus of foramen ovale during an annual checkup. What can be the possible structure involved?

An elderly person with a known history of hypertension presents to the clinic. He informs that he has been taking 50 mg hydrochlorothiazide for a while but it no longer helps in reducing blood pressure. He is given another medicine and a spontaneous fall in systolic blood pressure is seen. What is the medication?
At which costal cartilage level, the aortic valve is present?
Physical activity in healthy and fit individuals reduces the risk of cardiovascular disease by what percentage?
What are the types of antidotes which act by forming new less toxic compounds after combining with poison?
Which drug decreases mortality in ST-elevation myocardial infarction?
Which of the following is correct regarding age and color of a bruise?
Which of the following is incorrect regarding a stab wound?

answers.option: It is a wedge shaped opening wound
In this injury bruising around the opening of the wound is seen
It results from piercing with a pointed weapon
It may occur with a knife
